_header: Jesu lord that madest me / And with thy blessed blood hast bought
Note:
Based on an existing hymn (2905); five stanzas are interwoven in 2825; some of the opening stanzas are incorporated into 3918. For early printed Primers containing this hymn see Hoskins (1900)
XHoskins, Edgar. Horae Beatae Mariae Virginis: or, Sarum and York Primers…. London, New York: Longmans, Green, 1900; repr. 1983, 218, 222; Brydges and Haslewood (1810)
XSir Samuel Egerton Brydges, and Joseph Haslewood. The British Bibliographer. 4 vols. London: T. Bersley, vol. 1: 1810; vols. 2, 3: 1812; vol. 4: 1814, 4.139-40 (‘Psalter of Jesus’); and Bühler (1959)
XBühler, Kurt. “‘At thy golg first eut of the house vlysse the saynge thus.’” Studies in the Renaissance 6 (1959): 223-35, 235.
Subjects: hymns, to Christ; Christ, hymns to
_description: Richard de Caistre’s hymn — twelve quatrains

BodBar33.First Lines:
Ihesu lord that madest meAnd wyth thy blessid blood hath
                    boght…
BodBar33.Last Lines:
…And send men frutes of hertely foodeAs euery man nedyth in
                    hys degre

BodAsh751.First Lines:
Ihesu lord þat made me & with þi blessed blode has
                    boght…
Ihesu for þaime I ye besekeþat wrethed ye on any
                    wyse…
BodAsh751.Last Lines:
…Here & spede my prayeres& spare me þat I be not
                    spilt
…ffor wham I hafe had any gude& spare þat we haue
                    done omys
BodAsh751.Note:
Presented in the MS as consisting of two parts, each 24 lines long. Both
                    have titles. ‘Amen’ occurs only at the end of the second
                    one.
BodAsh751.Attributed Title:
þo sauter of ihesu (f. 142); þo sauter of charyte (f.
                    142)
BodAsh751.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

BodLatLitE47.First Lines:
Ihesu lord þat madyst meAnd wyth þi blissyd blood hath me
                    bowth…
BodLatLitE47.Last Lines:
…ffor whom I hawe hadde any goodAnd spare þat þei
                    haue don amys
BodLatLitE47.Attributed Author: Oracio magistri Ricardi Castre vic’ in Norwico (f. 206)
BodLatLitE47.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 224-5.

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
…And neuer I mot do that thyngethat shuld the in any wise
                    displese…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…ffor whome I haue had any goodAnd spare that thei haue don
                    amys
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 275-6.

BodRawlite3.First Lines:
Ihesu lorde that madest me& with thi precious blode me
                    bought…
BodRawlite3.Last Lines:
…al hem þat I haue had any gode& spare hem þat
                    hathe doon amysse
BodRawlite3.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

OxfMert204.First Lines:
Ihesu lord that madest meAnd with thi blessed blod has me
                    boȝt…
OxfMert204.Last Lines:
…ffor whome I haue had any goodeAnd spare hem þat
                    þei haue don amys
OxfMert204.Note:
With heading attributing to Richard Castre, and major break between
                    stanzas 6 and 7 with the heading, ‘Psalterium caritatis fraterne’;
                    and at the end of verse and prose text on this folio in the same hand: ‘J
                    Gisburgh’.
OxfMert204.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

CULIi643.First Lines:
ihesu lorde þat madyst meAnd with þy blysfull blood hast
                    bouȝt…
CULIi643.Last Lines:
…ffor þe wheche y haue had anye goodAnd spare þat
                    þey han don amysse Amen
CULIi643.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

CamFitz40-1950.First Lines:
Ihesu lorde that madest meAnd with thy blessed blode hast
                    bought…
CamFitz40-1950.Last Lines:
…Here & spede my prayeresAnd spare me that I be not
                    spilt
CamFitz40-1950.Note:
With marginal note ‘Pater noster’ to left of each stanza;
                    added by a contemporary hand; 6 x 4, abab.

CamSidney80.First Lines:
Jhesu as thow madest me& with thi blessed blode hast me
                    bouth…
CamSidney80.Last Lines:
…That y haue had of eny godeAnd for ȝeue hem that han don
                    amysse Amen
CamSidney80.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             A Descriptive Catalogue of manuscripts in the Library of Sidney Sussex
                College, Cambridge.
         Cambridge: at the UP, 1895: 65-6.

CamTCC305.First Lines:
Ihesu lord þat made me& wiþ þi blisful blood
                    hast bouȝt…
CamTCC305.Last Lines:
…And whom I haue had ony good& space al cristen þat
                    doon amysse
CamTCC305.Note: Written 2 lines to a line of MS.
CamTCC305.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

BLAru285.First Lines: Ihesu lord that maid meAnd with thy blissit blude hes bocht…
BLAru285.Last Lines: …ffor quhom I haue had ony gudAnd forgyf þame all thair miss
BLAru285.Attributed Title: Ane orisoun to þe Naim of Ihesu Crist (rubric, bottom f. 176v)
BLAru285.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Arundel MS 285.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?index=0&ref=Arundel_MS_285.
BLAru285.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.
Bennett,  Jack Arthur Walter,
                        ed.  
             Devotional Pieces in Verse and Prose from Ms. Arundel 285 and Ms.
                Harleian 6919.
Scottish Text Society
         3rd ser. 23. Edinburgh: Blackwood, 1955: 277-8.

BLCottVesAXXV.First Lines:
Ihesu lorde as me made and with þe precious blode me beghtFor
                    gyf me þat I haue greuyd ye In worde werke wyl or
                    thoght…
BLCottVesAXXV.Last Lines:
…Ihesu on to thy mercy þu take vs synners þat for grace
                    doth prayqwen we schall for ouer dedys qwake a for þe lorde on
                    domysday
BLCottVesAXXV.Editions:
Böddeker,  Karl. 
             “Englische Lieder und Balladen aus dem 16. Jahrhundert.” 
             Jahrbuch für romanische und englische Sprache- und
                Literatur
         14 (or n.f. 2) (1875): 81-105 [933]: 111.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 98-100.

BLHarChart.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.
Davies,  Reginald Thorne. 
             Medieval English Lyrics: a critical anthology.
         London, 1963; Evanston, IL: Northwestern UP, 1964: 146-8.

Lam853.First Lines:
IHesu lord that madist meAnd wiþ þi blessid blood hast
                    bouȝtfforȝeue þat y haue greued þeeWith worde with
                    wil & eek with þouȝt…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Ihesu for Þi blessidful bloodBringe if þou wolt
                    Þo soulis to blisffor whom y haue had ony goodAnd spare þat
                    þei han do a mys. Amen
Lam853.Attributed Title:
Oracio magistri Richardi de castre quam ipse posunt (p. 28,
                    rubric)
Lam853.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 15-17.
Wülker,  Richard Paul,
                        ed.  
             Altenglisches Lesebuch.
         2 vols. in one. Halle: Lippert, 1874, 1880: 2.5-6.
Patterson,  Frank A. 
             The Middle English Penitential Lyric.
Columbia University Studies in English.
         New York: Columbia Press, 1911: 129-31.

Longleat30.First Lines:
Ihesu for hem I the besecheThat wrathen þi in any
                    wyse…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…ffro whom I haue had any goodAnd spare þat þei haue
                    done amysse Amen
Longleat30.Attributed Title:
Oracio magistri Richardi de castre quam ipse composuit (f. 20,
                    preceding usual opening stanza: ‘Ihesu lord þat madeste
                    me…’).
Longleat30.Editions:
Harford,  D. 
             “Richard of Caister and his Metrical Prayer.” 
             Papers of the Norfolk and Norwich Archaelogical Society
         17, Part II (1909): 221-44: 221-44.

Plimpton80.First Lines:
Ihesu lorde that madyst meAnd wyth thy blode me
                    bowght…
Plimpton80.Last Lines:
…Schew hem thy mercy there payne releceSwete lord for thy
                    mageste
Plimpton80.Editions:
Drake,  W. T. Tyrwhitt. 
             “Early English Poem.” 
             Notes and Queries
         4th ser. 2 (1868): 576: (60 lines).

YaleBei163.First Lines:
Yhesu lorde þat maydyst me& with thy precyus blode hast
                    bousthe…
YaleBei163.Last Lines:
…helpe me lady & all myne& shelde vs all fro hell
                    pyne
YaleBei163.Note: Written two lines of verse per line in MS.

HunHM142.First Lines:
Ihesu for hem I the besecheThan wrehen the in any
                    wyse…
HunHM142.Last Lines:
…ffor whom I haue had any goodAnd spare þat þei haue
                    doone amysse
HunHM142.Note:
Oracio Magistri Castre quam ipse composuit (f. 17, after first
                    six quatrains), then seventh begins, ‘Ihesu lord that madeste me / And
                    with þi blessid blode haste bought…’.
HunHM142.Attributed Author:
Oracio Magistri Castre quam ipse composuit (f. 17, after first six
                    quatrains)
HunHM142.Attributed Title:
Oracio Magistri Castre quam ipse composuit (f. 17, after first six
                    quatrains)

Mazar514.First Lines:
Iesu lorde þat madyst meAnd wyt thy blesyt blode hasse
                    boght…
Mazar514.Last Lines:
…Of wom I haue hade ony godeAnd spare þat þay haue
                    done amisse
Mazar514.Note:
48 lines, plus two additional; f. 146, between stanzas 6 and
                    7.

TokyoTak17.First Lines:
Jhesu lorde þat madyste meAnd with þi precious blode me
                    bought…
TokyoTak17.Last Lines:
Scele þis werys & lende vs peceWith lasting loue &
                    charyte
